DIY iSock

28 Oct 2011

I was eating brunch with a friend the other day when she pulled out her iPhone, covered in a cute little iPod sock. It almost looked like a toque (very fitting for the chilly weather we’ve been having); it was pretty adorable. So I decided my iPhone should look equally cute.

I keep putting off buying a case or any kind of screen protector, so why not a sock? Off I went to the Apple online store to check out the iPod socks. I discovered that they come in packs of six, for $39 ($45 with shipping). This seems like a bit much when you consider, they’re just socks. And they’re not even full socks. Really, each one is like half a sock. Would you pay $45 for three socks? So then I thought: “I could make that.” So I did.

I found a stripey sock with the heel worn out (which I would’ve thrown out soon anyway) and transformed it into my very own iSock.

 

How to make an iSock:

1. Find a sock (when in doubt, look at your feet, and you may very well find one there).
2. Cut off the top 4.5” or so (depending on the size of your iPhone or iPod, and just leave enough for a seam).
3. Turn inside out.
4. Sew the cut edge together.
5. Sew in the side of the sock so that it’s tight enough to hold onto your iPod or  phone without slipping off.

Et voilà, you have an iPod sock! It’s ridiculously simple, right? And definitely not worth $45. Sure, it doesn’t have a fancy little Apple tag on it, but it does the trick, and if you recycle an old sock it will cost you a grand total of $0.
